title: 5-Point Proposal by Advisory Committee to Economic Council
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Advisory Committee appointed to assist the National Economic Council had submitted 5 proposals to the NEC.
The Advisory Committee met President Gotabaya Rajapaksa for the first time on Monday (21), and made the submissions.
1. Immediately appoint a Technical Committee with Central Bank, and Treasury representation to propose on International Financial facilities.
3. Technical Committee must expedite the submission of a restructuring program for International Financial facilities.
4. Identify a group of experts to support the Finance Minister.
5. Increase confidence by addressing obstacles in the supply process.
The Advisory Committee further noted that it is important to take short-term and long-term measures to strengthen refinancing for a more stable economy that will be steered in the right direction.
